messages.content: First of all I should apologise that we are now facing another election. However, it should be noted that whilst none of us actually relish seven weeks of TV and radio coverage of the election I do firmly believe that the Prime Minister has made the correct decision. In order to plan confidently for the future of our country during what will be a significant period of change we clearly need to have a strong and stable Government to take us through the negotiating period and more importantly to be able to implement changes without constantly being expected to dance to the tune of others.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support for the Prime Minister's efforts to leave the European Union in a constructive manner with the views and concerns of all taken into account.
The need for a strong and stable Government to navigate the negotiating period and implement changes efficiently.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have attempted to be approachable and available in the Constituency since I was first elected in 2010 and in Westminster I have served as a Government Whip and Wales Office Minister since 2016. I was honoured to be asked to continue in both roles by Theresa May when she became Prime Minister. I now have the privilege of once again asking the people of Aberconwy to re-elect me as their Member of Parliament in what will be, in my view, a significant and important election which will shape the future of our country.
